content.prompt: Which of the following claims is correct for the electric field at point P and gives a correct physical reason to support this claim?

choices.label: The electric field at point P is zero, because the two rings have equal and opposite charges.
The electric field at point P will be to the left, because the electric field from the larger ring will be larger in magnitude.
The electric field at point P will be to the left, because the electric field from the smaller ring will be larger in magnitude.
The electric field at point P will be to the right, because the electric field from the larger ring will be larger in magnitude.
The electric field at point P will be to the right, because the electric field from the smaller ring will be larger in magnitude.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
